channel.title: Grey's Log on
channel.description: Recent content in Grey's Log on

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, the following instructions guide you through installing the proper dependencies to run it locally.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: Stay in the suck
item.description: It seems like the last thing Philly gave me was a sunburnt, and the first thing Dallas gives me is a cold.

item.title: The small battles matter
item.description: Day in, day out. This is water. This is water.

item.title: Day 2 in Dallas
item.description: it’s hard to start

item.title: Being fat is a symptom
item.description: As if fate would have it, I’m writing this on my cheat day. I’m following the [[02-daily-rambling/Slow carb diet|slow carb diet]], and Saturday is the scheduled failing day - I eat whatever I want and however much I want.

item.title: Goodbye, Schuylkill
item.description: Today I said my goodbye to the Schuylkill river by taking a long walk along the river trail. I walked past the art museum.

item.title: Allow things to go wrong
item.description: Life is an ever-lasting training program, and I have so much to learn. For me, allowing things to go wrong is an important skill to learn, and to practice to get better at.

item.title: James Clear
item.description: This is a template for people have inspired or helped me and made my life better. I’ll write more about them in the future.

item.description: This is a template for people have inspired or helped me and made my life better. I’ll write more about them in the future.

item.description: This is a template for people have inspired or helped me and made my life better. I’ll write more about them in the future.

item.title: Robert Sapolsky
item.description: Everything I learned about PFC, I learned from Sapolsky.

item.title: Tim Ferriss
item.description: This is a template for people have inspired or helped me and made my life better. I’ll write more about them in the future.

item.title: Hollow Knight - Pure Vessel
item.description: Warning: contains spoilers of the game Hollow Knight. Hollow Knight is one of my favorite games. Pure Vessel is a character in the game.

item.title: food log
item.description: 2023-07-29 I wonder if the body craving more food after being full comes is related with having food shortage in childhood.

item.title: Slow carb diet
item.description: My current diet is the slow carb diet brought up by [[03-my-people/Tim Ferriss]]. It’s simple and effective. I find it easier to stick to.

item.title: A day in my life
item.description: How you spend a day is how you spend your life. Discipline = freedom — Jocko Willink It’s important to build a structure of life.

item.title: The world is binary
item.description: I have no rigid evidence, only a hunch, that the world might be binary. Examples of the binary/ pairwise nature can be found in many places.

item.title: The power of recording
item.description: Like photons, we behave differently when observed. In one of his lectures on behavior biology, [[03-my-people/Robert Sapolsky]] mentioned that flashing a pair of eyes for 0.

item.title: One blog a day
item.description: I want to build a habit of putting out one blog everyday. They don’t have to be good, in fact I expect most of them to be crappy (like this one).

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Hosting with Docker
item.description: If you want to host Quartz on a machine without using a webpage hosting service, it may be easier to install Docker Compose and follow the instructions below than to install Quartz’s dependencies manually.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: quartz
item.description: Log what I have done to use quartz as my new site. Forked the repo jackyzha0/quartz: üå± host your own second brain and digital garden for free (github.

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: ‚Äú[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden Scaling Synthesis - A hypertext research notebook AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard Data Dictionary üß† sspaeti.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!
